translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The seventeenth chapter
The discussion of whether there is untimely death for an Arahant
“Is there untimely death for an Arahant?”
“Yes.”
“Is there a murderer of an Arahant?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …
“Is there a murderer of an Arahant?”
“Yes.”
“Is there untimely death for an Arahant?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is there untimely death for an Arahant?”
“Yes.”

original: Yo arahantaṁ jīvitā voropeti, sati jīvite jīvitāvasese jīvitā voropeti, asati jīvite jīvitāvasese jīvitā voropetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ arahantam jīvitā voropeti sati jīvite jīvita avasese jīvitā voropeti asati jīvite jīvita avasese jīvitā voropeti iti
translated: “When one deprives an Arahant of life, is it when there is life that he deprives him of life, or is it when there is no life that he deprives him of life?”
“It is when there is life that he deprives him of life.”

original: Hañci sati jīvite jīvitāvasese jīvitā voropeti, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“natthi arahato akālamaccū”ti.
analyzed: hañci sati jīvite jīvita avasese jīvitā voropeti no ca vata re vattabbe  natthi arahataḥ
translated: “If it is when there is life that he deprives him of life, then it is not correct to say that there is no untimely death for an Arahant.

original: Asati jīvite jīvitāvasese jīvitā voropetīti, natthi arahantaghātakoti?
analyzed: asati jīvite jīvita avasese jīvitā voropeti iti natthi arahanta ghātako ti
translated: If it is when there is no life that he deprives him of life, then is there no murderer of an Arahant?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is there untimely death for an Arahant?”
“Yes.”

original: Arahato kāye visaṁ na kameyya, satthaṁ na kameyya, aggi na kameyyāti?
analyzed: arahataḥ kāye visam na kameyya sattham na kameyya aggi na kameyya ati
translated: Would poison, a weapon, or fire not affect the body of an Arahant?”
“No, friend.”

original: nanu arahato kāye visaṁ kameyya, satthaṁ kameyya, aggi kameyyāti?
analyzed: nanu arahataḥ kāye visam kameyya sattham kameyya aggi kameyya ati
translated: “Then is it true that poison, a weapon, or fire does affect the body of an Arahant?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci arahato kāye visaṁ kameyya, satthaṁ kameyya, aggi kameyya, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci arahato kāye visam kameyya sattham kameyya aggi kameyya no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes, friend.”
“Then you should not say that there is no untimely death for an Arahant.

original: Arahato kāye visaṁ na kameyya, satthaṁ na kameyya, aggi na kameyyāti?
analyzed: arahataḥ kāye visam na kameyya sattham na kameyya aggi na kameyya ati
translated: “Would poison, a weapon, or fire not affect the body of an Arahant?”
“Yes, friend.”
“Then is it true that there is no one who kills an Arahant?”
“No, friend.”
“Then is it true that there is untimely death for an Arahant?”
“Yes, friend.”
“But, friend, has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: “nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sañcetanikānaṁ kammānaṁ katānaṁ upacitānaṁ appaṭisaṁveditvā byantībhāvaṁ vadāmi;🔽tañca kho diṭṭheva dhamme upapajjaṁ vā apare vā pariyāye”ti.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave sañcetanikānam kammānam katānam upacitānam a paṭisaveditvā byantībhāvam vadāmi  tat ca kho diṭṭhe iva dhamme upapajjam vā apare vā pariyāyeti
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, I do not say that all undertake things themselves.
But I say that some undertake things themselves and some undertake things through others, and some undertake things both themselves and through others.’
“Yes, friend.”
“Then you should not say that there is no untimely death for an Arahant.”

analyzed: na atthi arahataḥ akāla maccūti kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: There is no untimely death for the Worthy One. The Discussion of Untimely Death is finished.
